jcr:content.awardContent1: Covers full tuition, mandatory fees, and room and board. An additional annual award of $3000 is given for study abroad, short-term courses, summer internship tuition, or research support.
jcr:content.awardName1: The Gilbert and Marcia Kotzen Scholars Program
jcr:content.awardReq1: A competitive merit award that recognizes the best and brightest students interested in a transformative education at Simmons College. Thanks to a dedicated donor who cares deeply about advancing girls leadership one of these scholarships must be awarded to a Girl Scouts Must be applying as a freshman for the fall semester SAT score of 1850 or higher, or equivalent standardized test scores 3.3 or higher grade point average Must have undertaken the recommended college preparatory curriculum Must have enrolled in an advanced level math course beyond Algebra II during, or prior to, their senior year of high school Must have taken honors, advanced placement (AP) and international baccalaureate (IB) courses, as available in their high school systems
